Package ohos.agp.utils

Class Contour

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.utils.Contour

  • public class Contour
extends Object
    Describes the contour of a component.

    You can clip or draw a shadow by using a contour, which takes the form of a right-angled rectangle, a rounded rectangle, an oval, or a convex polygon.

    Since:
    5

    • Method Detail

      • setContourEncompassRect

        public void setContourEncompassRect​(int left,
                                    int top,
                                    int right,
                                    int bottom,
                                    float radius)
        Sets the contour by passing the coordinates of the rectangle and the radius of its rounded corners.
        Parameters:
        left - Indicates the X coordinate of the upper left corner of the specified rectangle.
        top - Indicates the Y coordinate of the upper left corner of the specified rectangle.
        right - Indicates the X coordinate of the lower right corner of the specified rectangle.
        bottom - Indicates the Y coordinate of the lower right corner of the specified rectangle.
        radius - Indicates the radius of the rectangle's rounded corners.
        Since:
        5

      • translate

        public void translate​(int dx,
                      int dy)
        Translates the current contour.
        Parameters:
        dx - Indicates the length to translate on the x axis.
        dy - Indicates the length to translate on the y axis.
        Since:
        5

      • setContourRect

        public void setContourRect​(Rect rect)
        Sets the contour using the specified rectangle.
        Parameters:
        rect - Indicates the specified rectangle.
        Since:
        5

      • setContourRect

        public void setContourRect​(int left,
                           int top,
                           int right,
                           int bottom)
        Sets the contour by passing the coordinates of the rectangle.
        Parameters:
        left - Indicates the X coordinate of the upper left corner of the specified rectangle.
        top - Indicates the Y coordinate of the upper left corner of the specified rectangle.
        right - Indicates the X coordinate of the lower right corner of the specified rectangle.
        bottom - Indicates the Y coordinate of the lower right corner of the specified rectangle.
        Since:
        5

        public void setOval​(int left,
                    int top,
                    int right,
                    int bottom)
        Sets the contour of an oval based on the coordinates of the specified rectangle.
        Parameters:
        left - Indicates the left bound of the rectangle.
        top - Indicates the top bound of the rectangle.
        right - Indicates the right bound of the rectangle.
        bottom - Indicates the bottom bound of the rectangle.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty​()
        Checks whether the current contour is empty, clear().
        Returns:
        Returns true if mMode is MODE_EMPTY, returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        5

      • clear

        public void clear​()
        Set the contour to be empty.
        Since:
        7

      • getRadius

        public float getRadius​()
        Obtains the radius of the current contour.

        Only the contour of round rect or circle can get a effective value.

        Returns:
        Returns the contour radius.
        Since:
        5

      • getRect

        public boolean getRect​(Rect rect)
        Sets the given rectangle with the rectangle of the current contour.
        Parameters:
        rect - Indicates the rectangle to set.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful, returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        5

      • setAlpha

        public void setAlpha​(int alpha)
        Sets the alpha value of the contour.
        Parameters:
        alpha - Indicates the alpha value to set. The value ranges from 0 to 255.
        Since:
        7
